pullRequest.title: Clear the opBrowserState Cookie when sending the logout request to framework.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Proposed changes in this pull request
Resolves wso2/product-is#10692.
The approach:
Clear the opBrowserStateCookie when sending the logout request to framework.
Store the opBrowserStateCookie value in the cache against the sessionDataKey.
Retrieve the opBrowserStateCookie value stored in the cache and use it for handling the logout response.
Refactor LogoutServlet.class to use opBrowserStateCookieValue String instead of the Cookie.
When should this PR be merged
After running the integration tests.

commit.message: Clear the opBrowserState Cookie when sending the logout request to framework.

afterCommit.message: Clear the opBrowserState Cookie when sending the logout request to framework.

nodes.bodyText: Can we add a param description
Can't we put this along with previous line?

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -814,11 +839,11 @@ private boolean getOpenIDConnectSkipUserConsent(HttpServletRequest request) thro
     /**
      * Sends logout token to registered back-channel logout uris.
      *
-     * @param request
+     * @param opbsCookieValue

nodes.bodyText: We are passing String instead of HttpServletRequest object, Can't this cause an issue in callee?
can paramMap become null here? if so, handle null check
Need debug logs to indicate how the obps value was resolved.

I prefer to rename this something like opBrowserState?
obps cookie was one way to track the opBrowserState. And in the subsequent requests where the cookie is not present we are actually retrieving the same opBrowserState using some other means.
